class anduryl.ui.results.LegendTable(dialog)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QTableWidget

This widget is the table besides the distributions plot. It functions as an interactive legend, in which different lines can be toggled on and of.

construct_widget()[source]¶

Constructs the widget.

set_rows()[source]¶

Fill in the legend with all the expert id’s and weights

class anduryl.ui.results.PlotDistributionsDialog(parent)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Dialog in which the assessments of all experts, the result decision maker and all items are visualized. For one item different types of plots can be chosen: CDF, Exceedance probability, PDF and the range. Per expert only the range can be shown, since the scales of each item varies.

connect_signals()[source]¶

Connects the signals (again). This function and “disconnect_signals” are used to be able to change the dialog settings without updating all the figures.

construct_widget()[source]¶

Constructs the widget.

disconnect_signals()[source]¶

Disconnects the signals (again). This function and “connect_signals” are used to be able to change the dialog settings without updating all the figures.

format_axis(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)[source]¶

Set axis limits, called after a plot has been changed.

get_expert_data()[source]¶

Get all the data to plot for a certain expert

get_item_data(full_dm_cdf)[source]¶

Get all the data to plot for a certain item

Method to initiate expert plot

init_item_plot()[source]¶

Method to initiate item plot

Initialize the expert or items plot. Called after constructing the widget or after experts or items are chosen.

Set axis title, called after a plot has been changed.

Method to update the expert plot after changes are made to the data selection.

update_plot()[source]¶

Method to update a plot after changes are made to the data selection.

update_plotby()[source]¶

Initialize the expert or items plot type. Called after constructing the widget or after a different plot type is chosen.

update_realization()[source]¶

Set realization as line in plot. If target question, hide the line

class anduryl.ui.results.PlotExcludedDialog(parent)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

Dialog that shows the sensiticity of excluding experts or items from the project on the information and calibration score. The spread is shown by a box plot for each number of excluded experts or items.

calculate()[source]¶

Calculate the robustness for all combinations of excluding experts. This method is called after the calculate button is pressed.

check_maximum()[source]¶

Gets the maximum number of calculations and sets the progess bar accordingly.

construct_widget()[source]¶

Constructs the widget.

get_n_combinations()[source]¶

Get the number of combinations for excluding the selected number of experts or items.

plot()[source]¶

Update the figure plot, called after calculation.

update_progressbar()[source]¶

Update the progressbar with one step, after each iteration.

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QScrollArea

Widget with results for a decision maker.

Set up the result overview in the user interface.

plot_excluded_items()[source]¶

Opens a dialog to plot robustness for excluding multiple items.

plot_items()[source]¶

Opens a dialog to plot the distributions for experts and decision makers.

Opens a dialog to information scores per item.

ui_add_robustness_table(key, index, array)[source]¶

Adds a robustness table (experts or items) to the UI

Parameters

  • key (str) – Experts or Items

  • index (list) – Index for each table row

  • array (np.ndarray) – Numpy arra with values to show in table

class anduryl.ui.results.ResultsWidget(mainwindow)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame

Widget that contains all resultoverview in seperate tabs.

add_results(settings)[source]¶

Add results in an Resultsoverview to the tabs. The specific results are derived from the settings, and passed to the overview

Parameters

settings (dictionary) – Calculation setting

close_results(index=None, expert=None)[source]¶

Removes results from the widget. Results can be removed by index or by expert id. If the results are removed by index, the results are also removed from the expert widget. The function is thus used in slightly different ways.

Parameters

  • index (int, optional) – Index of results to remove, by default None

  • expert (str, optional) – Id of expert (decision maker) to remove, by default None
